mods.note: ; I p- M US GAT. 35/30 . Expedition by the Sultan against the Beni Kuaheh and His Highness'Requests for a Loan from the Government of India Oct.1896 to Aug.1899. i i r>Telegram No. 265-E,A., dated the 22nd February 1898. From—The Foreign Secretary, Calcutta, To—The Resident at Bushire. Your telegram 15th January. Maskat Customs. Actual and direct control by GoYernment of India would conflict with independence of Sultan secured by declaration 1862. Object may be sufficiently secured by Sultan appointing British official as Superintendent of bis Customs. If advance is necessary to bring about appointment, the Political Agent may offer to Sultan not more than one year's Customs income on security of Customs revenue. Smaller advance preferred if arrangement can be made for less. S E—12-19—March.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 35/30 Expedition by the Sultan against the Beni Ruaheh tribe and His Highness' Request for a Loan from the Government of India'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: The foliation system in use is the sequence of numbers appearing in a circle in the top right hand corner of each page. In addition there is a foliation system written in blue. Foliation omission: f 24.

mods.abstract: Correspondence relating to the request by Faisal bin Turki [Fayṣal bin Turkī], Sultan of Muscat for a loan of 40,000 Rupis [Rupees] in order to conduct a campaign against a rebellious tribe, the Beni Ruaheh [Bani Ruwāhah]. It contains a statement of the Sultan's financial position including the system of farming out the customs. Correspondents include Faisal bin Turki [Fayṣal bin Turkī], Sultan of Muscat; Captain Francis Beville, Political Agent Muscat; Political Resident Persian Gulf, Foreign Department in the Government of India, Simla.
